oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: School for the Blind
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tennessee School for the Blind and surrounding area; stereograph photo showing horses and carriage, cattle enclosure; a few houses; fenced area behind school.
The school purchased the Claiborne mansion on Fillmore Street (now Hermitage Avenue) in 1872, added mansard roof, tower, wings and cupolas
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Calvert, Peter Ross, 1855-1931; Calvert, Ebenezer, 1850-1924
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Calvert Brothers Studio Glass Plate Negatives
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cows; Horses; Historic buildings; Architecture; Arches; Electric lines; Towers
Schools; Educational facilities; Steeples; Mansions; Cupolas
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Surrogate print of this item is available in the Library Photograph Collection. Drawer 24, Folder 66
